alert.note: Alert for Posey (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 11:16AM EST until March 18 at 2:12PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois...Indiana... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, and Golconda. .Along the Ohio River, several points are rising to a secondary crest Friday or this weekend. Afterwards, river levels will be falling, currently projected to drop below flood stage next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY, MARCH 18... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 18. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 41.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 42.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, March 18. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
